conbody.p: At a minimum, Java 6 is required, but any newer version is also supported (including the newly released Java 8).

Currently, the Java SDK is in a beta release state, so you need to include the Couchbase Maven Repository if you want to pull it in automatically. Here is a typical pom.xml that you can copy and paste into your Java project:

You can also download an archive that has all JARs and dependencies included, but in general using a package manager is strongly recommended. After the final version is released, the SDK will be distributed through Maven Central and you can omit the custom repository definition.
If you import the dependency, the following transitive dependencies will also be added:

ul.li: core-io: our internal core library, which abstracts lots of Couchbase-specific behavior in a language neutral way.
RxJava: a foundational library to build reactive and asynchronous applications.
